alert.note: Alert for Le Flore; Pushmataha (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 11 at 9:11PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Pushmataha and southeastern Le Flore Counties through 845 PM CST... At 811 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles southwest of Mountain Fork to 9 miles south of Albion. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Octavia... Honobia... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM CDT for southeastern Oklahoma.
